description: Add a clump or pebble particle trace. The positions and velocities of clumps/pebbles can be sampled and stored during a model run and the path through space can be visualized. The optional id directly following trace creates a particle trace with the specified ID. If not specified, then the next available particle trace ID is used. The optional pebble keyword indicates that a pebble is to be traced. Following this, either 1) a position vector or 2) an additional id keyword must be given to identify a specific clump or pebble. See the trace commands for details regarding the manipulation of particle traces.

keywords.name: id
keywords.description: Specify the particle trace ID. If not provided, next available trace ID is automatically assigned

keywords.name: pebble
keywords.description: Indicate that a pebble is to be traced. Without this keyword, a clump is traced

keywords.name: id (identifier)
keywords.description: Identify the specific clump or pebble to trace by its ID

keywords.name: position vector
keywords.description: Identify the clump or pebble to trace by its position vector (closest entity to this position)

notes: Particle traces sample and store positions and velocities during model run
Traces can be visualized to show particle path through space
Optional trace ID: if not specified, next available ID is used
Two identification methods: 1) id keyword + ID number, or 2) position vector (finds nearest)
pebble keyword switches from clump tracing to pebble tracing
See 'trace' commands for full particle trace manipulation capabilities
Traces persist across model runs until explicitly deleted
